title: Subsea ICP with CLFL Correction
question: On {{wellProfile.wellName}}, you are in {{wellProfile.waterDepth.value}} {{wellProfile.waterDepth.unit}} water depth. SCR pressure is {{scenario.scr}} psi, SIDPP is {{scenario.sidpp}} psi, and CLFL at kill rate is {{wellProfile.chokeLineData.clflAtKillRate[0].clfl}} psi. Calculate the subsea ICP.

steps: Add SCR pressure (slow circulating rate pressure)

feedback.correct: Correct. Subsea ICP = {{answer}} psi. In subsea operations, CLFL must always be added to account for friction in the long choke line.
feedback.incorrect: Subsea ICP = SCR + SIDPP + CLFL. Simply add all three values: {{scenario.scr}} + {{scenario.sidpp}} + {{wellProfile.chokeLineData.clflAtKillRate[0].clfl}} = {{answer}} psi.
feedback.hint: Unlike surface operations, subsea must account for choke line friction. Just add the three pressures together.

contextualTip: With {{wellProfile.waterDepth.value}} {{wellProfile.waterDepth.unit}} water depth, the choke line creates significant friction loss. Always verify CLFL was measured at your planned kill rate.
